physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient found to be cyanotic and macrocephalic but alert. Severe weakness of both legs, right leg more affected; most severe at the level of the quadriceps muscle with some degree of amyotrophy. Increased patellar and ankle reflexes, Babinski sign present on both sides. Diminished pinprick sensation found in the L3–4 dermatomes on the right leg.
Postoperative imaging showed vascularized lesions of the vertebral body at the C-6 and T-2 levels; also confirmed vascularity at T5–8 levels and L-5 level.
Cervical and thoracolumbar MR images showed stable lesions; spinal cord compression at C-6 and L-5 levels was almost completely eliminated.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At the most recent outpatient neurological evaluation, patient was able to walk independently, jump on both legs separately, and reported no thoracolumbar pain.
